p.sentence: The International Military Tribunal was opened on November 19, 1945, in the Palace of Justice in Nuremberg.
The first session was presided over by the Soviet judge, Nikitchenko.

The prosecution entered indictments against 24 major war criminals and seven organizationsâ€”the leadership of the Nazi party, the Reich Cabinet, the Schutzstaffel (SS), Sicherheitsdienst (SD), the Gestapo, the Sturmabteilung (SA) and the "General Staff and High Command", comprising several categories of senior military officers.
These organizations were to be declared "criminal" if found guilty.
